executive_summary.purpose: Track progress on understanding and analyzing the Seven Millennium Prize Problems
executive_summary.current_stage: Framework ingestion complete, beginning analytical review

problem_details.name: P vs NP Problem
problem_details.problem_statement: Does P = NP? In other words, can every problem whose solution can be quickly verified by a computer also be quickly solved by a computer?
problem_details.ai_ml_relevance: **VERY HIGH** - Central to computational complexity and algorithm design
why_matters_for_ai: Directly impacts optimization algorithms
Affects machine learning complexity bounds
Implications for neural architecture search
Relevant to automated theorem proving
barrot_approach: Study relationship between verification and solution in AI contexts
Analyze NP-complete problems (traveling salesman, SAT, etc.)
Test if neural networks can "learn" to solve NP problems efficiently
Create practical algorithms even if P ≠ NP
current_insights: **Initial Understanding**: Problem is about the fundamental limits of computation
**AI Connection**: Many ML optimization problems are NP-hard
**Practical Impact**: Even if P ≠ NP, good approximations matter for AGI
next_steps: Deep dive into complexity theory foundations
Study recent proof attempts and approaches
Analyze computational patterns in Arc-AGI that relate to P vs NP
Test neural network performance on NP-complete benchmarks

problem_details.name: Hodge Conjecture
problem_details.problem_statement: For certain "nice" spaces (complex projective algebraic varieties), can all Hodge classes be expressed as combinations of classes of algebraic cycles?
problem_details.ai_ml_relevance: Medium - Connects to geometric deep learning
why_matters_for_ai: Relates to manifold learning and dimensionality reduction
Connections to topological data analysis
Potential insights for graph neural networks
Geometric understanding of high-dimensional spaces
barrot_approach: Study algebraic geometry basics
Understand Hodge theory and cohomology
Look for computable patterns in algebraic cycles
Connect to modern geometric ML techniques
current_insights: **Initial Understanding**: Problem is about algebraic topology and complex geometry
**Challenge**: Requires deep mathematical foundation beyond current scope
**AI Angle**: Geometric deep learning may provide intuitions
next_steps: Explore connections to topological data analysis

problem_details.name: Riemann Hypothesis
problem_details.problem_statement: All non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function have real part equal to 1/2.
problem_details.official_status: Open (most famous unsolved problem in mathematics)
problem_details.ai_ml_relevance: Medium - Pattern recognition in zeros distribution
why_matters_for_ai: Prime number distribution impacts cryptography
Number theory patterns relevant to random processes
Zeta function appears in quantum field theory
Pattern recognition challenges for neural networks
barrot_approach: Compute and visualize zeta zeros
Use ML to find patterns in zero distribution
Study statistical properties of zeros
Connect to physics and information theory
current_insights: **Initial Understanding**: Problem about distribution of prime numbers
**Verification**: Billions of zeros computed, all satisfy hypothesis
**AI Application**: Neural networks could search for patterns or counterexamples
next_steps: Visualize zero distributions with ML tools
Review computational approaches to the hypothesis

problem_details.name: Yang-Mills Existence and Mass Gap
problem_details.problem_statement: Prove that Yang-Mills theory exists mathematically and that it has a "mass gap" (minimum energy above the vacuum state).
why_matters_for_ai: Quantum field theory principles may inspire new architectures
Understanding vacuum states relevant to energy-based models
Gauge theories have abstract connections to symmetry in neural networks
Quantum ML may eventually need these foundations
barrot_approach: Learn quantum field theory basics
Understand gauge theories and particle physics
Numerical simulations where possible
May inform quantum neural network development
current_insights: **Initial Understanding**: Problem requires advanced theoretical physics
**AI Relevance**: More relevant to future quantum AI than current AGI

problem_details.name: Navier-Stokes Existence and Smoothness
problem_details.problem_statement: Prove that solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations (describing fluid flow) always exist and remain smooth, or find a counterexample.
problem_details.ai_ml_relevance: **HIGH** - Direct applications in physics-informed neural networks
why_matters_for_ai: Fluid dynamics simulation crucial for many AI applications
Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) use Navier-Stokes
Understanding turbulence relevant to chaotic systems
Potential for ML-assisted proof discovery
barrot_approach: Implement Navier-Stokes solvers
Use neural networks for fluid simulation
Study chaotic regime behavior
Look for patterns suggesting smoothness or blow-up
current_insights: **Initial Understanding**: About existence and smoothness of fluid flow solutions
**Practical Relevance**: Extremely important for engineering and physics
**AI Opportunity**: Neural networks already used for fluid simulation

problem_details.name: Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer Conjecture
problem_details.problem_statement: For elliptic curves, the rank of the group of rational points equals the order of vanishing of the associated L-function at s=1.
problem_details.ai_ml_relevance: Medium - Connections to cryptography and number theory
why_matters_for_ai: Elliptic curves used in modern cryptography
Number theoretic patterns relevant to security
Abstract algebra principles apply to coding theory
Pattern recognition in arithmetic structures
barrot_approach: Learn elliptic curve theory
Calculate ranks and L-functions
Use ML to detect patterns in elliptic curve data
Link to practical security applications
current_insights: **Initial Understanding**: Connects algebraic and analytic properties of curves
**Cryptographic Importance**: Elliptic curves central to modern cryptography
**Computational Angle**: Extensive databases available for testing
next_steps: Analyze elliptic curve databases with ML

problem_details.name: Poincaré Conjecture ✅
problem_details.problem_statement: Every simply connected, closed 3-manifold is homeomorphic to the 3-sphere.
problem_details.ai_ml_relevance: Medium - Topology relevant to manifold learning
why_matters_for_ai: Topology crucial for understanding high-dimensional data manifolds
Manifold learning fundamental to dimensionality reduction
Geometric insights apply to neural network optimization landscapes
Historical lesson in rigorous proof methodology
barrot_approach: Understand Perelman's proof approach
Learn 3-manifold theory
Study the geometric flow technique
Apply topological insights to manifold learning

activity_log.activity: Begin P vs NP deep analysis

riemann_hypothesis.quick_summary: All non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function have real part equal to 1/2.
riemann_hypothesis.ai_relevance: Medium - Pattern recognition in zeros distribution
riemann_hypothesis.status: Open (most famous unsolved problem in mathematics)
riemann_hypothesis.computational_approach: Numerical analysis, pattern detection with ML, statistical analysis of zeros
riemann_hypothesis.key_insight: Billions of zeros computed, all satisfy hypothesis - neural networks could search for patterns

p_vs_np.quick_summary: Does P = NP? In other words, can every problem whose solution can be quickly verified by a computer also be quickly solved by a computer?
p_vs_np.ai_relevance: **VERY HIGH** - Central to computational complexity and algorithm design
p_vs_np.impact: Central to computational complexity and algorithm design
p_vs_np.ml_connection: Many ML optimization problems are NP-hard

navier_stokes.quick_summary: Prove that solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations (describing fluid flow) always exist and remain smooth, or find a counterexample.
navier_stokes.ai_relevance: **HIGH** - Direct applications in physics-informed neural networks
navier_stokes.practical_use: Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) for fluid simulation
